    n = int(input())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    global_max = max(a)
    global_min = min(a)
    # Find all positions of global_max and global_min
    pos_max = [i for i in range(n) if a[i] == global_max]
    pos_min = [i for i in range(n) if a[i] == global_min]
    left = min(pos_max[0], pos_min[0])
    right = max(pos_max[-1], pos_min[-1])
    # Compute regions 1 and 2
    max1 = -inf; min1 = inf
    for i in range(left):
        if a[i] > max1: max1 = a[i]
        if a[i] < min1: min1 = a[i]
    max2 = -inf; min2 = inf
    for i in range(right+1, n):
        if a[i] > max2: max2 = a[i]
        if a[i] < min2: min2 = a[i]
    # region3: between left and right, excluding global_max and global_min
    max3 = -inf; min3 = inf
    has_elements = False
    for i in range(left, right+1):
        val = a[i]
        if val == global_max or val == global_min:
            continue
        has_elements = True
        if val > max3: max3 = val
        if val < min3: min3 = val
    candidates = []
    if max1 != -inf and min1 != inf:
        candidates.append(max1 - min1)
    if max2 != -inf and min2 != inf:
        candidates.append(max2 - min2)
    if has_elements:
        candidates.append(max3 - min3)
    max_candidate = max(candidates) if candidates else 0
    term1 = (global_max - global_min) + max_candidate
    
    # Compute term2: max (max_inside - min_inside) over proper intervals.

    min_a2 = min(a2) if a2 else 0
    diff2 = max_a2 - min_a2 if a2 else 0
    
    term2 = max(diff1, diff2)
